articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: After a slow and chaotic start to the new U.S.-backed aid system in Gaza, thousands of Palestinians have been arriving at distribution points, seeking desperately needed food despite scenes of disorder and fears of violence.
articles.title: Gaza aid system under pressure as thousands seek food

articles.author: Samuel Indyk, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Winners on financial markets included chip makers, banks, luxury stocks and the auto industry, all hit hard by tariff-led disruptions.
articles.title: US ruling that Trump tariffs are unlawful stirs relief and uncertainty

articles.author: David Lawder
articles.description: President Donald Trump's global tariff assault may be slowed but won't be stopped by court rulings that may ultimately force a shift to other legal authorities for his campaign to pressure countries into trade concessions, trade and legal experts say.
articles.title: If trade court ruling stands, Trump seen shifting to other options for tariff assault

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un led a party meeting on strengthening the military on Wednesday and inspected an artillery drill on Thursday, state media KCNA said on Friday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un leads meeting on strengthening military, inspects artillery drill

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's government has approved 22 new Jewish settlements in the occupied-West Bank, Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said, a move that could deepen divisions with some allies, who have threatened sanctions over further expansion.
articles.title: Israel announces new West Bank settlements despite sanctions threat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cambodian authorities have said they detained some Japanese nationals in a joint effort to crack down on fraud centres in Cambodia, a Japanese government spokesperson said on Thursday.
articles.title: Japan says nationals detained in Cambodia in joint battle on fraud

articles.author: Lucila Sigal
articles.description: The homicide case against Diego Maradona's medical team was declared a mistrial, their lawyers said on Thursday.
articles.title: Mistrial ruled in case against Diego Maradona's medical team, lawyers say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Thursday that Russia was engaging in "yet another deception" by failing to hand over its peace settlement proposal ahead of a potential meeting between Moscow and Kyiv.
articles.title: Zelenskiy accuses Russia of 'another deception' by holding back peace memorandum

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. trade talks with China are "a bit stalled" and getting a deal over the finish line will likely need the direct involvement of President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Thursday.
articles.title: US-China tariff talks 'a bit stalled,' needs Trump, Xi input, Bessent says

articles.author: Steve Holland, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Some Republicans in Congress and White House advisers are urging U.S. President Donald Trump to finally embrace new sanctions on Moscow as frustration mounts over Russian President Vladimir Putin's military assault on Ukraine.
articles.title: Pressure mounting on reluctant Trump to impose sanctions on Russia
